Description: Body sherd from shoulder of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery dinos; white slip on exterior, mostly worn: from top, black-figure decoration lion (two paws remaining), to right, above black band; below, faint traces of undetermined black-figure motif and incied inscription.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Site 51 (Hogarth), an ‘early chamber’ in the area of the Aphrodite sanctuary and Scarab Factory (Hogarth 1898-9, 41; Edgar 1898-9, 50) (close to)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
'Naukratis 1899' is marked on the interior of the fragment. Williams (2006a, 128) notes that Chian dinos sherds are often mistaken for oinochoai because of the lack of slip on the interior surface.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (pl. IV, no. 48)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 699, no. 570, pl. 25.19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0033) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
